comments:
If I create a plugin project, and put it at C:\test, then when I try to debug, I
will get an empty dialog telling me some error occur.
Look at the .log file, I found the following stack trace,

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[4]: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException:
 at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:56)
 at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:41)
 at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.removeFirstSegments(Path.java:689)
 at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.TargetPlatform$LocalSite.getRelativePluginList(TargetPlatform.java:66)
 at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.TargetPlatform.createConfigurationEntries(TargetPlatform.java:292)
 at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.TargetPlatform.savePlatformConfiguration(TargetPlatform.java:233)
 at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.TargetPlatform.createPlatformConfiguration(TargetPlatform.java:181)
 at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.createWorkspaceRunnerConfiguration(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:220)
 at .......


If I change the plugin project at c:\test\test, then everything will go fine.

I looked at the source code, and don't quite understand what the -3 mean.
Could you please move it to PDE-UI.

You have moved it :-)

But I believe it belong to the "Core" component. The exception is caused by the
core always assume plugins are at directories that has more than 3 path segments.
*** Bug 48728 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
